newsitem.title: USA: Intel CEO eyes 15-17 pct PC growth target.
newsitem.headline: Intel CEO eyes 15-17 pct PC growth target.

text.p: Intel Corp's president and chief executive officer Andy Grove said the personal computer industry is expected to continue to target 15 to 17 percent growth.
"That's our objective -- to keep it at that growth rate," Grove told a news briefing after his keynote address to the Comdex PC industry trade show here.
Grove noted that the industry has broadly grown at a rate of 15 to 17 percent for the last 10 years.
He said the next challenge for the industry was to produce life-like three-dimensional capabilities.
Out of a score of 100 points, the industry should be able to deliver satisfaction of around 40 in three-dimensional capabilities by the year 2000, Grove said.
